title: 112_hr4373
content: The Act may be cited as the "Making Adoption Affordable Act of 2012" and includes expanded tax benefits for adoption made permanent. The "Making Adoption Affordable Act of 2012" includes permanent expansions for adoption tax benefits, with amendments to increase the dollar limitation for adoption credits. The "Making Adoption Affordable Act of 2012" includes permanent expansions for adoption tax benefits, with amendments to increase the dollar limitation for adoption credits to $13,170. Subsection (h) of section 23 of the Code is also amended for inflation adjustments. The "Making Adoption Affordable Act of 2012" increases dollar limitations for adoption credits in subsections (a)(3) and (b)(1) based on cost-of-living adjustments. Income limitations are also adjusted for taxable years starting after December 31, 2002. The "Making Adoption Affordable Act of 2012" increases dollar limitations for adoption credits in subsections (a)(3) and (b)(1) based on cost-of-living adjustments. The dollar limitation for adoption assistance programs is amended to $13,170 for child with special needs. The "Making Adoption Affordable Act of 2012" increases the adoption credit dollar limitation to $13,170 for a child with special needs, amending section 137(a) of the tax code. The dollar limitations for taxable years after December 31, 2010, are increased by a cost-of-living adjustment. If the adjusted amount is not a multiple of $10, it is rounded to the nearest multiple of $10. Additionally, the income limitation for taxable years after December 31, 2002, is also increased. The dollar limitations for taxable years are increased by a cost-of-living adjustment determined for the calendar year. The amount is rounded to the nearest multiple of $10.
